title: About me
content:
## ***Who I am***

I'm a postgraduate student who is applying PhD program in Chemistry, Metallic Catalysis and Nanomaterials Application. Since my primary major is Environmental Science, which as an interdisciplinaries, thus, there are many directions that can be further studied. During my Master’s degree in Shanghai Jiaotong University, I did some academic researches in noble-metallic catalysis for nitrates reduction. The most importantly, I aim to continue pursuing my research in Chemistry direction,with broadening my insights with more professional knowledge, being commited to exploring the intriguing catalytic world. I also have many others interests like Photography, music video clip,travel and music. For me, the meaning of life is to be professionally and wonderful.


 
## ***My Education Background*** **My Graduate School**

| Shanghai Jiao Tong University
Major: Environmental Engineering
Topic: Metallic Catalysis|2018.09-2021.03 :----|:----|----:   **My undergraduate School**
| Anqing Normal University
Major: Environmental Science| 2014.09-2018.06 :----|:----|----:   ## ***My Honors & Awards***

* The National Scholarship for Postgraduates | 2019-2020

* Academic Excellence Scholarship | 2018-present

* The Excellent Graduating Student | 2018

* Academic Excellence Scholarship | 2014-2018

* The National University Student Social Practice Science Contest on Energy Saving and Emission Reduction | The 3rd Prize, 2016

* The Student of Excellence | For four years, 2014-2018

* The Excellent Presentation Award, The 7th International Symposium on Environmental Science and Technology | 2019

* Excellent Oral Presentation Award, The 21st Cross Straits Symposium on Energy and Environmental Science and Technology | 2019

title: RESEARCH
content:
## ***My recent papers***
Low amount weight Pd-Cu are loaded on various oxides supports and combine with electrolytic in-situ H2 generation for NO3R， which be confirmed an promising combined method to fulfill converting NO3- to N2. And different supported materials demonstrates huge NO3R rate and N2 selectivity disparity. For NO3R rate, Pd10%Cu2.5%/TiO2>Pd10%Cu2.5%/γ-Al2O3>Pd10%Cu2.5%/CeO2, while Pd10%Cu2.5%/γ-Al2O3 obtains better N2 selectivity than the other two. Crucially, the oxygen vacancies (VO) existing in TiO2 and CeO2 can reduce the nearby Cu2+ to Cu+, also Cu2+ can attract electrons from Pd0 to form Cu+ on the γ-Al2O3 surface,these Cu+ based active sites on the surface of substrates are vital for effective NO3− adsorption and high N2 selectivity.
 Cu+ based active sites of different oxides supported Pd-Cu catalysts and electrolytic in-situ H2 evolution for high-efficiency nitrate reduction reaction](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jcat.2020.10.012)
Author: C. Chen, H. Zhang, K. Li, Q. Tang, X. Bian, J.n. Gu, Q. Cao, L. Zhong, C.K. Russell, M. Fan, J. Jia X. Bian, T. Sun, J. Jia
Journal of Catalysis, 392 (2020) 231-243.

|[Combination of Pd–Cu Catalysis and Electrolytic H2 Evolution for Selective Nitrate Reduction Using Protonated Polypyrrole as a Cathode](https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.est.9b04447)
\*Author: C. Chen, K. Li, C. Li, T. Sun, J. Jia
\*Environmental Science & Technology, 53 (2019) 13868-13877. :----|:----
|[Electrolytic nitrate reduction using Co3O4 rod-like and sheet-like cathodes with the control of (220) facet exposure and Co2+/Co3+ ratio](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.electacta.2020.137121)
\*Author: K. Li, C. Chen,X. Bian, T. Sun, J. Jia
\*Electrochimica Acta, (2020) 137121. :----|:----
|[Effects of phase structure of MnO2 and morphology of δ-MnO2 on toluene catalytic oxidation](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.electacta.2020.137121)
\*Author: K. Li, C. Chen, C. Chen, H. Zhang, X. Hu, T. Sun, J. Jia
\*Applied Surface Science, 496 (2019) 143662. :----|:----   ## ***Other contributions works*** * F. Shi, C. Chen, J. Li, J. Liang, X. Bian, C. Bao, J. Jia, Bimetallic γ-Al2O3-Pd/Cu hydroreduction of nitrate in simulated wet denitrification wastewater combined with in situ electrocatalytic H2 production, Water Research, (2021) [Under Review] * C. Li, K. Li, C. Chen, Q. Tang, T. Sun, J. Jia, Electrochemical removal of nitrate using a nanosheet structured Co3O4/Ti cathode: Effects of temperature, current and pH adjusting, Separation and Purification Technology, 237 (2020) 116485. * J.-n. Gu, J. Liang, C. Chen, K. Li, W. Zhou, J. Jia, T. Sun, Treatment of real deplating wastewater through an environmental friendly precipitation-electrodeposition-oxidation process: Recovery of silver and copper and reuse of wastewater, Separation and Purification Technology, 248 (2020) 117082. * Q. Cao, C. Chen, K. Li, T. Sun, Z. Shen, J. Jia, Arsenic(V) removal behavior of schwertmannite synthesized by KMnO4 rapid oxidation with high adsorption capacity and Fe utilization, Chemosphere, 264 (2021) 128398.

title: Welcom to Felicity's Website
content:
# About me
# 


## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)
